level.heading: Signing and filing pursuant to judicial order.

level.text: If a person required by this chapter to sign a record or deliver a record to the Mayor for filing under this chapter does not do so, any other person that is aggrieved may petition the Superior Court to order:
The person to sign the record;
The person to deliver the record to the Mayor for filing; or
The Mayor to file the record unsigned.

If a petitioner under subsection (a) of this section is not the limited liability company or foreign limited liability company to which the record pertains, the petitioner shall make the company a party to the action.
A record filed under subsection (a)(3) of this section is effective without being signed.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 29-801.07 and § 29-802.05.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 added (c).

level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 204 of the Uniform Limited Company Act (2006 Act).
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
